No. 4367)} Sub: Procedure for disposal of RTI Applications and Appeals -reg: Ref.: 1) Office Order 11041/131/2005-Admn.IIl dated 19.09.2005 (Annexure-I): ji) Office Order No. 11041/131/2005-Admn.III dated 09.03.2009 (Annexure-II) _ iii) Office Order No. 11041/131/2005-Admn.IIl dated 08.10.2009 (Annexure-IlI). iv) Office Order No. 11041/131/2005-Admn.III dated 31.12.2009 (Annexure-IV)_ v) Office Order No. 11041/131/2005-Admn.IIl dated 09.04.2013 (Annexure-V)_ In addition to the existing procedure prescribed in above references, the following additional measures, provided vide DoPaT's Order No.02/10/2010-CR dated 16/07/2010, are approved by the Competent Authority, in dealing with the RTI Applications and Appeals in the Authority: (i) It has been decided that no CPIO shall refuse to accept an application which has been marked to him_ her by the APIO, NHAI (HQ) and any RTI Application shall not be returned to the APIO by the CPIO. In case this happens, APIO, NHAI (HQ) would immediately bring this to the notice of CGM or I/c CGM or GM in charge of Coordination Division who will take further necessary action urgently and if needed, bring it to the notice of the higher Authorities_ Such cases of refusal or returning by CPIO would be viewed extremely seriously and may result in disciplinary action. (ii) However, in case a CPIO is genuinely aggrieved with wrong marking of an RTI request, he will personally bring it to the notice of CGM or I/c CGM or GM in charge of Coordination Division who will either refuse the request or agree to Transfer [in Full or Part of] the RTI request to another CPIO(s). If a change is made, the application will be routed again through APIO, NHAI (HQ) who will make necessary corrections in the RTI-MIS. It is, however , reiterated that till the time the application [or a part thereof] is transferred to another CPIO by the APIO, NHAI (HQ), the CPIO to whom it was originally marked will continue to remain responsible: (iii) The remaining procedure in dealing with the RTI applications shall remain the same as prescribed in references cited above. 2_ This issue with the approval of Competent Authority. Encl:: As stated above. 0e/28" (CS. Sanjay Kumar Patel) Ilc Chief General Manager (Coord.)
